item.title: Kingdom Come Deliverance 2‚Äôs Third Story DLC Arrives Next Month
item.content:encoded:
Deep Silver has announced that Kingdom Come Deliverance 2‚Äôs third story DLC, Mysteria Ecclesiae, will arrive on November 11, 2025, for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC. The new expansion will take players to Sedletz Monastery, where they will ‚Äúinvestigate a deadly mystery‚Äù. The DLC will introduce a brand-new storyline to the game, featuring fresh quests, interesting characters, and endings you will not see coming.

Henry Plays a Detective in Kingdom Come Deliverance 2‚Äôs Mysteria Ecclesiae DLC

In Kingdom Come Deliverance 2‚Äôs Mysteria Ecclesiae DLC, players will see Henry play a detective as he unravels the secrets of a quarantined monastery. Henry is trying to figure out the cause behind the sudden disease outbreak, which will be told through a new cinematic quest.

The new area, Sedletz Monastery, will be unlocked with the expansion and will remain accessible even after completing the DLC. The ‚Äúnew level features a historically accurate new location that‚Äôs rich in detail and life.‚Äù The DLC will also include a new outfit, weapons, potions, and books that will help expand Henry‚Äôs knowledge and abilities. Interested readers can check out the latest trailer below:

Talking about DLCs, KCD 2‚Äôs Legacy of the Forge expansion arrived last month, where players got to learn more about their father‚Äôs legacy as a blacksmith. While reliving these memories, the players complete an ambitious masterpiece their father once worked on. Moreover, the expansion also introduced a home customisation system with over 100 million combinations to personalise your forge, private quarters, and its surroundings.

In other news, Kingdom Come Deliverance could reportedly receive an upgrade ‚Äòearly next year‚Äò. Additionally, Tom McKay‚Äôs last day in the Kingdom Come booth has come and gone. Are you going to play Kingdom Come Deliverance 2‚Äôs third DLC, Mysteria Ecclesiae? Let us know through the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about a new Battlefield 6 datamine revealing that battle royale is arriving on October 28. Don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Two More Black Ops 2 Remastered Maps Are Coming to Black Ops 7 Season 1
item.content:encoded:
Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 is bringing back some fan-favorite Black Ops 2 maps for Season One of the game.

Releasing on November 14th, Black Ops 7 continues the Black Ops series name, as well as its story. Players will finally reunite with the Mason family from Black Ops 2 and witness another mind-bending narrative, now with friends. However, it seems the story isn‚Äôt the only thing coming back, as two remastered maps from Black Ops 2 are returning for the new entry, as said by Activision.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 2‚Äôs Standoff and Meltdown Return as Season One Maps in Black Ops 7

In a Dev Talk with the team at Treyarch, the team revealed two Black Ops 2 maps returning for Black Ops 7 as part of Season One: Meltdown and Standoff. Each map will be remastered and available as part of the next batch of maps, though a release date was not given. Standoff did join Black Ops: Cold War‚Äôs roster of maps during Season Three, acting as both a Multiplayer map and Zombies map. However, Meltdown has not been in the series since Black Ops 2 back in 2012, so fans will be excited to return to the nuclear powerplant.

The Season One roadmap for Black Ops 7 was revealed today as part of the Dev Talk. Seven maps, including Meltdown and Standoff, will will release during the season, with more to come later. Three other Zombies maps, two being Survival, are also coming in Season One. The team is calling the new season its biggest yet and based on what we can tell, it sure seems to be. Either way, both new and returning players are in for a treat when it releases on November 14th.

Are you excited to return to Standoff and Meltdown? Any maps you hope make a return for Black Ops 7? Will you be getting the game at launch? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Call of Duty, check out our articles on the lack of skill-based matchmaking and debunked early release rumors. Don‚Äôt forget to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!
